alice.tuprologx.spyframe

Class SpyFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • alice.tuprologx.spyframe.SpyFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SpyListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class SpyFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, SpyListener
    GUI-Window for tracing the solving process of a prolog goal. This Frame runs its own prolog process and is its only SpyListener. The prolog process is suspended at every step.
    Author:
    franz.beslmeisl at googlemail.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • contexts2tree

        public static final ToTree<java.util.List<ExecutionContext>> contexts2tree
        An anonymous singleton instance building a tree out of a list of ExecutionContexts.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpyFrame

        public SpyFrame(Theory theory,
                Term goal)
         throws InvalidTheoryException
        Creates the main window for spying a prolog goal finding process.
        Parameters:
        theory - for the prolog engine.
        goal - the prolog term to be tested.
        Throws:
        InvalidTheoryException - if we have no valid prolog theory.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Continues the prolog process and sets the number of steps to be skipped. A step is done by every prolog-Call.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - not used because at the moment we have only the input field producing this event. This might change in the future.

      • onSpy

        public void onSpy(SpyEvent e)
        Display the spied information in form of a tree. This method reacts only on prolog-Calls and skips even those if the number of steps set in actionPerformed is bigger than 1. In this case the number is decremented to skip these steps. After display the prolog process is suspended until the user presses enter.
        Specified by:
        onSpy in interface SpyListener
        Parameters:
        e - information about the actual state of the prolog process.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Spies the solving process of a prolog goal.
        Parameters:
        args - array of length two containing the filename of the theory and the goal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the theory or the goal are nonsense.
